item.title: Postgresql: Whitelist IP
item.description: Edit pg_hba.conf file located in /etc/postgresql/{version}/main/pg_hba.conf. Example entry to allow IP Address 10.20.30.40 to connect to test database host test test 10.20.30.40/32 md5 Restart postgresql: sudo service postgresql restart Check if server is running and accepting connections: pg_isready

item.title: MySQL: Create User and Database
item.description: Login with mysql client Create new user CREATE USER 'new_user'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'password'; In order to grant all privileges of the database for a newly created user, execute the following command: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON * . * TO 'new_user'@'localhost'; // grant on all GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON database_name.* TO 'username'@'localhost'; For changes to take effect immediately flush these privileges by typing in the command: FLUSH PRIVILEGES; Revoke Privileges REVOKE ALL PRIVILEGES ON * .

item.title: Run Script in background on system startup with nohup
item.description: Install nohup which is used to run processes in background sudo apt install nohup Create a simple shell script in /usr/local/bin which is gonna be responsible for starting the script via nohup. #! /bin/sh nohup php8.0 /path/to/myscript.php >/dev/null 2>&1 & Make it executable: sudo chmod u+x myscript.sh Symlink script to /etc/init.d/ sudo ln -s /usr/local/bin/myscript.sh /etc/init.d/ Symlink the symlink to /etc/rc2.d. Prepend the scriptname with S[NUMBER]. Number is used by the system to determine the order of executing the scripts in the /etc/rc2.
